intro: Dalechampia caperonioides, commonly known as the Capron's spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, with a unique structure that includes both male and female parts.
